description.narrative: Engaging female and male adolescents and youth to foster positive and online and offline engagement to prevent the spread of hate speech and disinformation in Sri Lanka

participating-org.narrative: MPTF-UN Sri Lanka SDG Multi-Partner Trust Fund

provider-org.narrative: MPTF-UN Sri Lanka SDG Multi-Partner Trust Fund
MPTF-UN Sri Lanka SDG Multi-Partner Trust Fund

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output 1: Data and Trend Analysis is available to stakeholders to identify early signs of radicalisation and violent extremism 1.1 Working group set up and modalities agreed upon 1.2 # of sub grants issued to support working group activities 1.4 Establishment of Functional Center that collects, consolidates, and presents evidence-based data on hate speech, social tension/cohesion and violence
Output 2: Improved linkages between government and civil society to inform inclusive frameworks that respond to the challenges of violent extremism 2.1. Partnership mapping and gap analysis with key stakeholders on the PVE related legislative and policy environment in Sri Lanka conducted 2.2 # of multi-stakeholder dialogues conducted with government, civil society (particularly with women, youth and religious groups), and PVE experts to develop inclusive recommendations for PVE policy and frameworks
Output 3: Increased knowledge and tools available to communities to counter violent extremism, hate speech and intolerance 3.1 Periodic political economy scoping and gender analysis assessments carried out 3.2 Periodic community assessments to identify areas of tension and gaps in local governance and of existing civil society actors and entry points conducted

Output 2: Improved linkages between government and civil society to inform inclusive frameworks that respond to the challenges of violent extremism 2.1: 0 2.2: 2 (1 National and 1 Sub-national)

Output 1: Data and Trend Analysis is available to stakeholders to identify early signs of radicalisation and violent extremism 1.1: 0 (No target set as the working group set already) 1.2: 2 (1 CSO grants activity at national level and 1 youth programme initiated at Sub-national) 1.4: 0
Output 2: Improved linkages between government and civil society to inform inclusive frameworks that respond to the challenges of violent extremism 2.1: 0 2.2: 2 (Working group consultative meeting at National Level)
Output 3: Increased knowledge and tools available to communities to counter violent extremism, hate speech and intolerance 3.1: 0 (Ongoing, but not finalized) 3.2: 1 (Policy paper with recommendations on PVE, drawing on the dialogues conducted )

Output 1: Data and Trend Analysis is available to stakeholders to identify early signs of radicalisation and violent extremism 1.1: 1 1.2: 1 1.4: 1
Output 2: Improved linkages between government and civil society to inform inclusive frameworks that respond to the challenges of violent extremism 2.1: 1 2.2: 1
Output 3: Increased knowledge and tools available to communities to counter violent extremism, hate speech and intolerance 3.1: 1 3.2: 1

Output 1: Data and Trend Analysis is available to stakeholders to identify early signs of radicalisation and violent extremism 1.1: 1 (Working group set in participation of 09 civil society organizations) 1.2: 09 grants provided for CSOs. to support working group activities 1.4: 1 (Operationalized UNDP Crisis Risk Dashboard for Sri Lanka in collaboration with UNDP Crisis Bureau and the RCO)
Output 2: Improved linkages between government and civil society to inform inclusive frameworks that respond to the challenges of violent extremism 2.1: 1 (Sri Lanka’s first primary data-based research into the drivers of violent extremism and spread of hate speech in Sri Lanka. The findings shared for UN country conflict analysis) 2.2: Platforms for community and inter-cultural dialogs established- 60 online dialogs/ 3 community radio dialogs and 15 face to face dialogs
Output 3: Increased knowledge and tools available to communities to counter violent extremism, hate speech and intolerance 3.1: 1 (Launched a series of Political Economy and Gender Analysis of current PVE interventions and online and offline trends in Sri Lanka 3.2: 1 (A Household survey conducted to assess the socio-economic and social cohesion impact of Covid-19 4/6 survey cycles (representing 2000 households) completed. The findings contributed to the UN advisory paper to the GoSL)

Output 2: Improved linkages between government and civil society to inform inclusive frameworks that respond to the challenges of violent extremism 2.1: 0 2.2: 2 (Working group consultative meeting at National Level)
Output 3: Increased knowledge and tools available to communities to counter violent extremism, hate speech and intolerance 3.1: 0 (Ongoing, but not finalized) 3.2: 1 (Policy paper with recommendations on PVE, drawing on the dialogues conducted )
